title: Volvo XC40 T3 review: 'Want a compact, comfortable, upmarket SUV? Look no further'
text:
There’s a great deal to be said for keeping it simple. Cheddar on toast beats extra-mature havarti on a rough-cut, oven-crisped sourdough slice. A virtual reality walk in the countryside is undoubtedly a pale shadow of the real thing. And, if you’re buying a Volvo, it might behove you to keep it simple, too.

For while the Swedish company’s latest large cars are, for the most part, very impressive, replete with hybrid options and delightful wood’n’leather interiors, the XC40, at the smaller, less expensive end of the range, has proven a more complete package.

Ignoring the antediluvian – and not long for this world – V40, the XC40 is the cheapest car Volvo makes, though it isn’t exactly bargain-priced....
description: There’s a great deal to be said for keeping it simple.
